alert.note: Alert for Far Northeast Highlands; Johnson and Bartlett Mesas Including Raton Pass (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albuquerque (Northern and Central New Mexico)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 26 at 5:15PM MDT by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: ...STRONG THUNDERSTORMS WILL IMPACT PORTIONS OF NORTHEASTERN COLFAX COUNTY THROUGH 545 PM MDT... At 515 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 7 miles east of Sugarite to near Raton. Movement was northeast at 15 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Raton, Sugarite, Raton Crews Airport and Sugarite Canyon State Park. This includes the following highways... Interstate 25 between Mile Markers 440 and 455. Highway 64 between Mile Markers 337 and 361. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. These storms may intensify, so be certain to monitor your preferred media outlets and NOAA Weather Radio for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service. Accumulations of small hail on roads can create very slick and hazardous driving conditions.

area.areaDesc: Far Northeast Highlands; Johnson and Bartlett Mesas Including Raton Pass
